headline: Western Digital (WDC) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of leading data storage manufacturer Western Digital (NASDAQ: WDC) jumped 9.3% in the afternoon session after analysts grew more optimistic about the company's prospects ahead of its upcoming earnings report, with Bank of America significantly raising its price target on the stock. The firm maintained its "Buy" rating but increased its price target to $257 from $197, a jump of over 30%. Analysts cited several reasons for the positive outlook, including a stable pricing environment where d

headline: Bank of America drops bold call on Roblox, sees massive upside
summary: Roblox's future depends on one question: Can it keep making hits? The platform is getting ready for earnings season with a mixed configuration. headline: Western Financial Group Partners with Baking Association of Canada to Sweeten Employee Benefits and Commercial Insurance
summary: Western Financial Group, one of Canada's top insurance brokers, is proud to announce a new partnership with the Baking Association of Canada (BAC) — naming Western as the preferred provider of commercial insurance and employee benefits for BAC's network of over 500 baking businesses and affiliated members nationwide.

headline: Morgan Stanley Remains Bullish on Bank of America (BAC) Following Strong Q4 Results
summary: Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) is included in our list of the 10 Goldman Sachs undervalued stocks to invest in. On January 15, 2026, Morgan Stanley reduced its price target on Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) from $68.00 to $64.00, while reiterating an ‘Overweight’ rating. The update came after the company posted solid Q4 results, […]

headline: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From Bank of America’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Bank of America’s fourth quarter results were marked by robust revenue growth and higher earnings per share versus Wall Street expectations, but the market responded negatively. Management attributed the quarter’s performance to strong loan and deposit growth, increased net interest income, and disciplined expense management. CEO Brian Moynihan described the period as one that "delivered 7% year-over-year revenue growth," highlighting the impact of operating leverage and ongoing investments in t
